note: At present there is no online English translation of the entire Digest.
title: By far the most important source is the Digest. There is an English translation by a team of scholars headed by Alan Watson; it comes as a stand-alone edition with a facing Latin original
The Digest of Justinian

note: English and Latin] The titles of the Digest on the major delicts (theft, iniuria, and damnum iniuria datum) are easily accessible in a Penguin edition.
title: The Digest of Justinian

container-title: There is a very convenient edition of Gaius’s Institutes, in both Latin and English, with notes and a generous outline
title: The Digest of Roman law: Theft, Rapine, Damage and Insult

note: There is an edition, translation, and commentary on surviving statute law (of which there is surprisingly little) by another team. Further R eading
title: The Institutes of Gaius

container-title: Bulletin of the Institute of Classical Studies
title: Roman Statutes

note: Brief listings for every known trial (civil and criminal) during the period given. Alexander lists the parties involved, the legal issues, the result, the sources, and other information.
title: Trials in the Late Roman Republic, 149 bc to 50 bc

note: Further R eading Very handy reference work for the (Latin) terminology of Roman law.
title: Encyclopedic Dictionary of Roman Law
The Roman Law of Slavery: The Condition of the Slave in Private Law from Augustus to Justinian
Originally published in 1908, but still a handy compendium on this very important topic
Textbook on Roman Law
Law and Life of Rome
A very broad introduction to Roman law with much attention to social context and practical use of the law
Legal Advocacy in the Roman World
Particularly valuable for bringing together Egyptian documentary evidence for the practice of advocates in day-to-day litigation
The Rise of the Roman Jurists: Studies in Cicero’s Pro Caecina
Written around a particular case of Cicero’s, this book nonetheless looks into much broader issues of the status of jurists and their evolving role in the Roman legal system

note: This is the method by which American law schools generally teach.
title: A Casebook on the Roman Law of Delict. Atlanta, Ga.: Scholars Press. Collected texts (mostly drawn from the Digest) laying out particular cases, with annotation, to explain a variety of concepts of the Further R eading law of delict

note: Like the previous work, but covering family law.
title: A Casebook on Roman Family Law
Women in Roman Law and Society

note: These works focus on adoption, emancipation, and the relationship between mothers and their children.
title: Family and Familia in Roman Law and Life
Law and Family in Late Antiquity: The Emperor Constantine’s Marriage Legislation
Women and the Law in the Roman Empire: A Sourcebook on Marriage, Divorce and Widowhood
The Roman Law of Trusts
The history and use of trusts (fideicommissa) in the law of inheritance

note: A general introduction to Roman private law, with a special focus on its practical business applications.
title: Roman Law in Context
An Introduction to Roman Law
Further R eading General introduction to Roman law from a modern lawyer’s point of view

note: Policing and other means to maintain public order.
title: Public Order in Ancient Rome
Crime and Community in Ciceronian Rome
The procedures and offenses covered by the criminal courts of the late Republic

note: Detailed but readable account of both the sources for and sources of Roman law treated in Chapters 4 and 5 of this book.
title: The Sources of Roman Law: Problems and Methods for Ancient Historians

collection-title: Sets out the legal rules for paternal authority in cultural and demographic context
title: Patriarchy, Property, and Death in the Roman Family
A Short History of Roman Law. London and New York: Routledge. A history not so much of the law as of legal (and related political) institutions
The Spirit of Roman Law
Watson has written an enormous quantity of very technical works on all areas of the law, but this is a very basic account of his theories on the general production and interpretation of the law
